lines.content: * Represents the command to add a new task into the TaskList.
* Checks the task to be added into the TaskList.
* If the task is valid with correct parameters, adds the task in the TaskList.
* @throws RasputinException If task has incorrect parameters such as empty description or invalid time and date.
throw new InvalidTaskException("ERROR! The description of a task cannot be empty.");
throw new InvalidTaskException("ERROR! Deadline tasks require a deadline to be completed by.");
throw new InvalidTaskException("ERROR! Invalid deadline format.");
throw new InvalidTaskException("ERROR! Event tasks require a duration for the event.");
throw new InvalidTaskException("ERROR! Event tasks require a duration for the event.");
throw new InvalidTaskException("ERROR! Invalid event duration format.");
* Abstract class to represent commands to be executed in the chatbot.
public abstract void execute() throws RasputinException;
* Represents the command to delete a task from the TaskList.
* Removes the task at the given index from the TaskList.
* @throws InvalidTaskException If the given index is out of bounds of TaskList.
Ui.printText("Done, removed that task for you.\n" + tasks.get(index).toString());
throw new InvalidTaskException("ERROR! Task not found.");
* Represents the command to close the program when the user types "bye".
* Writes the TaskList into the .txt file and prints the farewell message.
* Will always return true as program will be terminated.
* Represents a command to find a task with description containing the keyword to search with.
* Searches the TaskList for tasks with descriptions containing the given search keyword.
* If no matching tasks are found, print a message saying no found matches.
* Else, print TaskList of matching tasks.
* @throws RasputinException If command is missing the keyword to search with.
throw new RasputinException("ERROR! Find command requires a keyword to search with.");
String output = String.format("Here are the matching tasks in your list.\n%s", foundTasks.toString());
* Represents an invalid command due to invalid parameters or input.
* Prints the error message thrown by the exception.
* Represents a command to mark a task as done.
* Marks the task at the given index of the TaskList as done.
* @throws InvalidTaskException If the given index is out of bounds of the TaskList.
Ui.printText("Marked that as done for you.\n" + tasks.get(index).toString());
throw new InvalidTaskException("ERROR! Task not found.");
* Represents command to print out the current list of tasks.
* Prints the current list of tasks.
* Represents a command to mark a task as not done.
* Marks the task at the given index of the TaskList as not done.
* @throws InvalidTaskException If the given index is out of bounds of the TaskList.
throw new InvalidTaskException("ERROR! Task not found.");
* Parses the input from the user to be passed into the commands.

* If input is valid, returns the command to be executed.
* @param input Input text from the user.
return new InvalidCommand("No tasks in list!");
return new InvalidCommand("ERROR! Task to be marked not specified.");
return new InvalidCommand("ERROR! Task not found.");
return new InvalidCommand("No tasks in list!");
return new InvalidCommand("ERROR! Task to be unmarked not specified.");
return new InvalidCommand("ERROR! Task not found.");
return new InvalidCommand("ERROR! Task to be deleted not specified.");
return new InvalidCommand("ERROR! Task not found.");
* Represents a chatbot to store a list of tasks for the user.
* Takes in the path of the .txt file containing the list of tasks to be read and written to.
* @param filePath Path of file to be opened.
* Starts the chatbot and parses input from the user until it is terminated.
* Class to read a .txt file to load into an ArrayList and read from an ArrayList to write to a .txt file.
* If the .txt file to be read is not found, create new file and write to it.
* Takes the filePath to open the file to be read and written to.
* @param filePath Path of file to be opened.
System.out.println("Task file not found, creating task file.");
* Reads from a .txt file to store an ArrayList of tasks.
* If file cannot be found or read, prints an error message.
Event event = new Event(split[2], split[3], split[4]);
* Writes the tasks in the TaskList to the .txt file.
* If writing to file is successfully, print a success message, else print error message.
* @param tasks List of tasks to write into file
str = String.format("%s|%s|%s|%s\n", type, isDone, description, by);
str = String.format("%s|%s|%s|%s|%s\n", type, isDone, description, from, to);
System.out.println("ERROR! Could not write to file.");
* Represents a task that has a deadline to be completed by. A Deadline object has a deadline represented by
* a string and a LocalDate or LocalDateTime.
* If the deadline given is not the correct format, throws an InvalidTaskException.
throw new InvalidTaskException("ERROR! Invalid deadline format.");
* Returns the string representation of the deadline.
* Represents a task that takes place during a particular duration.
* If the event duration given is not the correct format, throws an InvalidTaskException.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
throw new InvalidTaskException("ERROR! Invalid event duration format.");
* Returns the string representation of the start time of the event.

* Represents an error that occurs in the creation of a task.
* Represents a task to be completed. A task can be of 3 different types and can be marked as done or not done.
* Returns the status of the task. If task is done, return an "X", else, return a " ".
* @return Status icon of task as a String.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X

* Returns the description of the task.
* Returns whether the task is done.

* Prints the message after a command is executed in between two line breaks.
* Prints the list of tasks in between two line breaks.

public static void printAddTask(Task task, TaskList tasks) {
String output = String.format("Added %s task:\n%s", task.getType(), task);
output += "\nYou currently have " + tasks.size() + " task/s in your list.";
* Prints the greeting in between two line breaks when the user starts the chatbot.
